item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I always wanted to improve this wiki and now I'm able again! :D

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Day/Night mines are traps that can destroy Z's that reach that square. They are planted for 12 ZAP each (minus 2* your level in gardener, so max 10 ZAP). Daymines work from 7 am to 7 pm, nightmines from 7 pm to 7 am. Mines kill 1-4 z's per mine triggered.

As for the map, forest is dark green, arms depot is dark blue, wastelands is orange, collection plains is light green. Squares with hospitals have a red outline on the map, I believe, and blue outline for a bunker.

All the hospitals and bunkers will be outlined on the map, not just the ones at 0,0. This is assuming someone's gathered the map data, of course.

item.title: Colour of the pinged map?
item.content:encoded:
What colour is each area (Forest,Arms Depot, Wastelands, Collection Plains, hospitals, etc.) ? i think that this should be added to the guide because it would be really helpful to know where some of the areas are to get the weapons you want.

Oh, and do all the hopitals pop up on the map or only the first one at (0,0) ?

item.title: What are Day/Night mines?
item.content:encoded: What do they do?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: there seems to be a limit of 280 Zs per 'square'. (we accidentally started a hard zombja map with 7 active players xD and btw i think we can actually beat it ^^)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Hmm, seems that it still states in the guide that it's the zombulator hitting you that causes you to get zotted. Thrown back to 0,0, that is. But as previously stated, it's the gate itself that does, as you can be zotted even when there's no Z's there, and are searching the gate for a saber while the rest of the map is being cleared…might someone figure out an appropriate way to state this?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So how long does molly blindness last?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: One small remark. Cardio kicks in if you are disabled (infected HP under 40) and not when no weapon is equipped. Meaning, if you are all well, and unequip weapon, you can't use it to get cardio, as far as I know.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yep, gate permissions are the same as nuke, only the leader and anyone that's been given specific permission as such.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: i believe it's the leader or anybody the leader says can. (i know it's that way for nuke but not sure if it's the same for the gate) otherwise anybody should be able to.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: if i remember correctly those were the original 11saber stats before it was modified to what it is now. and besides, its just that awesome.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Just noticed. The 11 Saber's stats when fully upgraded skill wise is 11d11+11 Zs Killed, 111% Zetta Kill Chance, and 11% chance to break. Perhaps add this to footnotes as a trivia type thing? Because the 11Saber makes a lot more sense seeing the fully upgraded stats lol.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I think this has been added to the page, I couldn't find it anyway.
Runner!
No ZAP Used!
Cardio! While Weapon Disabled, x2 Runner chance!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: NUoSU does not, how ever, affect flame throwers 1 in 3 chance to double Zetta kill. As such, when using a flame thrower and NUoSU on a thumper with Cleave 3, you WILL kill 2 thumers and 9 Zs, but you will not automatically kill 4.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
nut up or shut up is an ability given to those with Survived the Impossible. it's effects allow a person to hit on all rolls without the interference of the RNG for one turn.

for example: shotgun on thumper with cleave 3 would kill 1 thumper and activate cleave with max damage (killing a second thumper and 3x1d3 Zs. for 9 Zs)

item.title: Nut up or shut up
item.content:encoded: What does that ability do?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The personal one shows that you lose stamina, The village one shows that you lose village contribution and take damage to all upgrades in addition to the stamina loss.

I'm not looking at the page right now so I may have missed something.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Well, they say different penalties…if one's the village message, and one is the personal, why don't they both show all the penalties?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No, as far as I know, one is the message that each player gets, and the other message is the one that shows up on village messages.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I'm assuming the Zombja Overrun lose message is if a zombja hits the last row, and the other is if you can't finish the map in time? I'd like to know exactly what I'm gonna get slammed with in a few days…

item.title: Lawn Mower
item.content:encoded: I have careful 4 (not 5) but the lawn mower is showing as a 1% break chance for me. According to the chart here it has a base break chance of 15% so it would still show 3% for me if that was the case(and there isn't some secret bonus I don't know about).

item.title: zombulator
item.content:encoded:
It is not the zombulator that throws you back , it is the gate itself.
Every Ap spend on that field you have that chance.
